Major_Arcs.title: Ghost Town and Family Conflicts
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Nan and Cal in a setting juxtaposing the old West with modern elements, setting up Nan's stubborn character and her conflicts with Cal and her father regarding romance, work, and the Ghost Town.

sub_scenes.title: Introduction and Romantic Rejection
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Nan and Cal and establishes Nan's independent nature and rejection of Cal's romantic advances in favor of her own work and disinterest in the ghost town.

narrative_arcs.title: Introduction to Ghost Town and the Stubborn Woman

sub_scenes.title: Departure and Modern Threat to Ghost Town
sub_scenes.description: Nan decides to visit the ghost town alone, reflecting on her past feelings. The scene abruptly shifts to a modern setting, revealing the threat of an airport construction that will destroy the ghost town, causing Nan distress.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Reflections on the Ghost Town
Disbelief, Explanation, and Nan's Emotional Reaction to Ghost Town Demolition

sub_scenes.title: Reconciliation and Family Conflict over Development
sub_scenes.description: Nan and Cal reconcile amidst the news of the airport. Nan's arrival at the ghost town reveals its destruction is underway, leading to conflict with construction workers and her father, who dismisses her feelings and threatens her.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Arrival at the Transformed Ghost Town and Dismay

Major_Arcs.title: Seeking Clarity and Romantic Resolution Amidst Crisis
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Nan's emotional journey, seeking clarity about her feelings for Cal and resolving their romantic tension against the backdrop of the ghost town's demolition and a looming weather crisis.

sub_scenes.title: Parental and Maid's Perspectives on Romance
sub_scenes.description: Nan's parents and the maid offer contrasting views on love and Cal's actions, influencing Nan's perspective and prompting her to seek clarity about her feelings for Cal.

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation and Forced Labor
sub_scenes.description: Nan seeks out Cal for confrontation, but is immediately directed to help with horses for the airport project, highlighting her forced involvement despite her opposition.

narrative_arcs.title: Yore Dad's Deal and No Backing Down

sub_scenes.title: Romantic Confession and Impulsive Action
sub_scenes.description: Nan confesses her feelings to Cal, leading to a conversation about their relationship. Impulsively, Nan drives the horses away, followed by a period of loneliness and reflection.

sub_scenes.title: Weather Crisis and Community Response
sub_scenes.description: A snowstorm escalates into a community crisis. Weather reports worsen, causing widespread concern. Amidst this, Nan and Cal have a tense exchange before the focus shifts to community worry and then hope.

narrative_arcs.title: Accusations and Defensiveness in the Snow
Seeking Comfort and Hope Amidst the Storm
Waking Up to Snow and Hopelessness
The Sound of a Plane and Hopeful Fodder Drop
Joyful Recognition of Fodder and Cal's Foresight

sub_scenes.title: Romantic Resolution and Recognition
sub_scenes.description: Amidst the relief and hope brought by the fodder drop, Nan and Cal finally achieve romantic recognition and resolution, solidifying their relationship.

Major_Arcs.title: The Ballad of Chane Benson and Jeff
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts focus to a side narrative about Chane Benson, a figure of admiration and controversy, and his impact on Jeff, a young man grappling with his identity and familial expectations.

sub_scenes.title: Introduction of Chane Benson and Public Reaction
sub_scenes.description: Chane Benson is introduced through his actions and the varied reactions of the townspeople, setting him up as a figure of interest and debate.

sub_scenes.title: Jeff's Past and Gun Obsession
sub_scenes.description: A woman reflects on Jeff's past and his unhealthy admiration for his brother. This transitions into a confrontation about Jeff handling guns and his rebellious admiration for Clyde Surrett, a criminal.

narrative_arcs.title: Reflecting on Jeff's Brother and Past

sub_scenes.title: Sally's Fear and Clyde's Intervention
sub_scenes.description: Sally expresses her deep concern about Jeff's growing obsession with guns and pleads with Clyde to help guide Jeff away from a dangerous path. They agree to work together for Jeff's sake.

narrative_arcs.title: Sally's Fear and Plea to Clyde

sub_scenes.title: Newspaper Article and Rising Tensions
sub_scenes.description: A newspaper article becomes a point of contention. Clyde is warned about Benson and the article, leading to a confrontation with Sally who accuses Clyde of betrayal for publishing it.

narrative_arcs.title: Defense of Past Actions and Article Mention
Warning about Benson and the Article

sub_scenes.title: Dinner Invitation and Escalating Conflict
sub_scenes.description: Benson justifies his journalistic duty, while Jeff learns about the article's impact. Sally invites Benson to dinner, leading to a dinner gathering and escalating tensions, culminating in Sally realizing Jeff is actually Chane Benson in disguise.

narrative_arcs.title: Article's Impact and Doubts about Clyde

sub_scenes.title: Physical Confrontation and Resolution via Newspaper
sub_scenes.description: Jeff/Chane's jealousy leads to a physical fight. Sally intervenes, realizing Clyde is in danger. A chase and confrontation ensue, resolved by changing the newspaper headline to announce Chane Benson's departure, leading to a family legacy in journalism.

narrative_arcs.title: Challenge for a Fair Fight and Anxious Wait
Printing the Clarion and Family Legacy

Major_Arcs.title: Western Ranch Conflict and Betsy & Steve's Romance
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts to a classic Western setting, focusing on range war tensions, the arrival of Steve Daley as foreman, Betsy's ranch management, and the developing romance between Betsy and Steve amidst external conflicts.

sub_scenes.title: Ranch Tensions and Steve Daley's Arrival
sub_scenes.description: A fight over gunplay on the ranch sets the tone, followed by the introduction of Steve Daley as the new boss hired by Betsy, establishing initial ranch dynamics and potential conflicts.

narrative_arcs.title: Introduction of Steve Daley as 'The Boss'
Discussion of Betsy's Ranch and Approaching Trouble

sub_scenes.title: Range War Threat and Betsy's Philosophy
sub_scenes.description: Steve Daley clarifies his role while range war tensions are discussed. Betsy's ranch philosophy is revealed, emphasizing running the ranch without gunmen, setting up a contrast with the escalating conflict.

narrative_arcs.title: Clarifying Steve Daley's Role and Concerns
Discussion of Impending Range War and Local Troubles
Offer of a Ride and Acceptance
Hank's Orders and Waiting for Dress Material
Decision to Hire Bodyguard and Ranch Philosophy
Clarification on Firing and Stance Against Gunslingers
Gratitude, Personnel Change, and Hank Yuh's Request

sub_scenes.title: Shopping Trip and Neighborly Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: Following a shopping trip, Lady Betsy faces confrontation from Fred Bridges and others, escalating into a physical fight defended by 'Neighbor', highlighting the rising tension and danger.

narrative_arcs.title: Post-Purchase Conversation and Steve Daley Mention
Discussion of Steve Daley's Abilities and Impending Danger

sub_scenes.title: Betsy and Steve's Romance and Gun Ultimatum
sub_scenes.description: Betsy sets a condition for Steve's employment regarding guns, leading to confessions of love and a dilemma for Steve, resolved when he agrees to give up his guns as proof of love.

narrative_arcs.title: Love's Proof and Surrender of Guns

sub_scenes.title: Escalating Range War and Hank's Ambush
sub_scenes.description: Ominous warnings precede escalating tensions, framing the situation as a 'declaration of war'. Hank is ambushed and captured, raising the stakes significantly.

narrative_arcs.title: Declaration of War and Betsy's Authority

sub_scenes.title: Steve's Rescue Attempt and Romantic Resolution
sub_scenes.description: Steve decides to rescue Hank, despite Betsy's pleas. A dangerous ride to Devil's Pass leads to a confrontation and resolution, culminating in Betsy and Steve's romantic reunion and a concluding reflection on their future.

narrative_arcs.title: Aftermath and Suspense at Devil's Pass

Major_Arcs.title: Love, Deception, and Beef Contract Drama
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc centers on Carrie, Dave, and Fred, exploring themes of love, deception, and business rivalry surrounding a crucial beef contract. It features emotional confrontations, mistaken intentions, and eventual reconciliation.

sub_scenes.title: Initial Conflict and Fence Dispute
sub_scenes.description: Mary confronts Dave, setting up initial tensions. This is followed by a fence dispute, escalating into a near gunfight and initial de-escalation.

narrative_arcs.title: Unexpected Visitors and Accusation of Fence Damage

sub_scenes.title: Romantic Interlude and Re-emergence of Conflict
sub_scenes.description: Dave and Carrie discuss the fence incident, leading to a romantic interlude abruptly interrupted by Fred Gordon's reappearance, hinting at unresolved tensions.

narrative_arcs.title: Confusion about Friendship and Second Chances
Romantic Interlude and Dismissal of Conflict

sub_scenes.title: Confessions, Flashbacks, and Romantic Proposal
sub_scenes.description: Conversations reveal complex romantic entanglements and past feelings. A flashback provides context to Carrie's feelings, leading to a romantic proposal from Dave.

narrative_arcs.title: Confession of Love for Fred Gordon
Desire to Bury the Hatchet and Romantic Overture
Flashback to Romantic Words and Proposal

sub_scenes.title: Betrayal, Confrontation, and Emotional Fallout
sub_scenes.description: Discussions about the Carlton contract reveal Fred's manipulative intentions. Carrie confronts Fred, feeling betrayed, leading to emotional distress and a resolve to fight back.

narrative_arcs.title: Discussion about Dave and the Carlton Contract

sub_scenes.title: Office Confrontation and Reconciliation
sub_scenes.description: Carrie confronts Carlton and Fred in the office. Emotional fallout and comforting words from her father lead to a final scene where Carrie seemingly concedes, but ultimately reconciliation and truth about the contract lead to renewed romance.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival and Confrontation at Carlton's Office
Apology and Inquiry about Feelings for Fred
Wagon Ride and Direct Confrontation about Love
The Beef Contract Revelation and Reconciliation with Fred

Major_Arcs.title: Dirk's Escape, Chris & Ransom's Love, and Wedding Interruption
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Dirk's escape after being shot, the complex love story between Chris and Marshal Ransom, leading up to their wedding day which is dramatically interrupted by Dirk's return.

sub_scenes.title: Dirk's Wound and Secret Meeting
sub_scenes.description: Dirk urgently seeks Carrie's help for a gunshot wound, leading to a secret meeting and medical examination, revealing the seriousness of Dirk's situation.

narrative_arcs.title: Dirk's Urgent Arrival and Plea for Help
The Secret Meeting and Dirk's Disguise
Dirk's Gunshot Wound and Medical Examination

sub_scenes.title: Investigation and Marshal Ransom's Inquiry
sub_scenes.description: Concerned parties initiate an investigation into Dirk's situation. Marshal Ransom arrives at the ranch, inquiring about Dirk's whereabouts and expressing concern.

narrative_arcs.title: Concern and Investigation into Dirk's Situation
Marshal Ransom's Arrival and Inquiry about Dirk
Confrontation with Rance Cready and Suspicion at the Ranch

sub_scenes.title: Legal Stance, Negotiation, and Romantic Confession
sub_scenes.description: Marshal Ransom confronts Dirk about the law, leading to negotiation and a plea for leniency. This transitions into a nighttime encounter and romantic confessions between Chris and Ransom.

sub_scenes.title: Escape Plan and Betrayal
sub_scenes.description: Chris proposes an escape plan, seemingly agreed upon by Ransom. However, internal conflict and a conspiracy reveal Chris's true intentions to betray Ransom and facilitate Dirk's escape.

narrative_arcs.title: Escape Plan Proposal and Seeming Agreement

sub_scenes.title: Pursuit, Gunfight, and Moral Dilemma
sub_scenes.description: Dirk and Chris's escape attempt is quickly pursued by Ransom. A gunfight ensues, leading to Chris's injury and a moral dilemma about harming Ransom to ensure escape.

sub_scenes.title: Recovery, Romantic Climax, and Wedding Interruption
sub_scenes.description: Ransom recovers, leading to romantic confessions and a marriage proposal. The wedding day arrives, filled with anticipation, but is dramatically interrupted by Dirk's return, creating a final confrontation.

sub_scenes.title: Resolution via Anecdotes and Rance's Reputation
sub_scenes.description: Anecdotes about Rance's past and his reputation for skill and honor are recounted, seemingly resolving the immediate confrontation with Dirk by highlighting Rance's superior capabilities and character.
